text.section: In this title the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Certificate of Competence" means certification obtained by a person through any organization accredited by the American National Standards Institute (ANSI), or the National Commission for Certifying Agencies (NCCA) that states the holder of the certificate demonstrates knowledge of and training in safe crane operating procedures.
"Commissioner" means the Commissioner of Labor and Industry in the Division of Labor and Industry in the Department.

section.section: "Crane" means a machine for lifting, lowering, and horizontally moving a load, that has a hoisting mechanism that is an integral part of the machine.

text.section: "Crane operator" means a person who operates a crane.

section.section:
"Operate a crane" means to use mechanisms inside a crane to guide the machine in:
the lifting, moving, positioning, and placing of large and heavy objects, earth, or other materials; or
the driving of large objects or materials into the ground.

"Operate a crane" includes:
the inspection of a crane;
assisting in the erection, adding to, or dismantling of a crane; and
the performance of routine maintenance on a crane.
"Operate a crane" does not include the movement of a crane on a State highway from one location to another location.
